intro: Satureja staminea, commonly known as Spanish thyme, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, featuring small, oval-shaped leaves with a fragrant, thyme-like scent. Its flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Satureja staminea is often used in cooking and traditional medicine for its aromatic and medicinal properties.
